nodes.bodyText:
This Deprecated method does not exist on master or develop and is not being used in this PR.
This method should be removed.

@RHenigan Thanks for your reply, these were the code examples, and to make the IOS/Android libraries mirroring each other. The @santhanamk, @akaremo have approved these changes as well previously, let me know if we still need to move forward strictly with the proposal
When VideoSrteamingRange is updated to match the proposal this class should no longer be needed
@RHenigan Thanks for your reply, linking this comment with the conversation above #1434 (comment)
@kostyaBoss Please refer to the conversation above #1434 comment
Can you fix the formatting in this if statement?
Why was this changed to use 1920x1080 instead of the resolution defined in the streaming parameters?

@RHenigan there are platform limitations on changing the size of the VirtualDispay itself. To make the display resizable we should avoid recreating it. Hence there was decided to create the display with 1920x1080 parameters and resize the view inside. I believe the 1920x1080 canvas resolution should cover all possible HMI displays
@kostyaBoss This is untrue. There could, for example, be portrait orientation streams: https://cdn.arstechnica.net/wp-content/uploads/2021/02/2021-Ford-Mustang-Mach-E-charging-screens-1-1440x1920.jpg

@joeljfischer Thanks for sharing this, let me explain the case which is the root cause. While testing it was discovered that there might come from the HMI resolution bigger than actual (which was used to start the streaming process). If this happens, according to Android platform specification and proposal's needs (do not stop the streaming process and restart it/do not stop encoding) we should not set the new size to VirtualDisplay object, but only work with the view inside. If the view is smaller comparing to VirtualDisplay canvas on the encoding level the "black" pixels will be filtered out by codec. Hence, it was decided to hardcode the 1920x1080 resolution for starting the display.
I can rollback this to previous values (getting initial w/h from capability) but in this case, if the new capabilities will come with a higher resolution comparing to VD w/h defined previously the image will be cropped by the width of the VD
Previously, while testing this implementation internally there was an input that on HMI there will be no control on the user input and the user can set the new capability with higher resolution eventually
Should I revert the change? Please, let me know the next steps decided regarding this item

Hello @kostyaBoss per the proposal the video streaming process should be stopped and restarted. and this change should be reverted
https://github.com/smartdevicelink/sdl_evolution/blob/master/assets/proposals/0296-Update-video-streaming-capabilities-during-ignition-cycle/Resolution_Switching.svg
Can you remove this import and use DebugTool instead of android Log
This commented block should not be included in the changed
Can you fix the formatting here, this line should not be indented

Currently with this implementation we do not update the existing parameters with the capabilities received. This was the goal of SDL 0323
If the parameters sent to this method are not null we still want to update them based on the capabilities received.
I propose removing the check if parameters are null if (parameters == null) { and create params just before calling getCapability()
final VideoStreamingParameters params = ( parameters == null) ? new VideoStreamingParameters() : new VideoStreamingParameters(parameters);
Hi @RHenigan, in terms of SDL 0323, your suggested change above looks good to me. Thanks.
@RHenigan could you please check if the suggested implementation for this case is suitable?

This will cause all apps to subscribe for VideoStreamingCapabilities even apps that dont use the Video Streaming feature. In the changes for VideoStreamManager you are adding a OnSystemCapabilityListener for VideoStreamingCapabilities.
I dont believe this change to BaseSystemCapabilityManager is needed.

This is a public method on a public class and would technically be a breaking change.
Please revert the changes to shutdown() and deprecate it.
Then implement shutdown(boolean withPendingRestart)

This is a public method on a public class and would technically be a breaking change.
Please revert the changes to stopStreaming() and deprecate it.
Then implement stopStreaming(boolean withPendingRestart)
Why was this change made? to convert from the touchCoord value to the MotionEvent pointer wouldnt we still want to multiple by the scalar value?
@JulianKast I've modified the code a little bit to match with the primitive type

This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                                    VideoStreamingParameters params = new VideoStreamingParameters();
          
      
    
    
  

By removing this line the params created at the begining of processCapabilitiesWithPendingStart will be used and then will be updated based on the capability retrieved

To maintain alignment with the iOS library and since the proposal is to Stop the Video stream and then start it again I recommend that we should not add a PAUSED state and should use the STOPPED state where appropriate
@RHenigan this was requested by @joeljfischer previously. Are you sure we should remove this state?

@kostyaBoss although this matter was discussed in the review it is not reflected in the final proposal and since the VideoStreamService should be stopped and then started again in this use case I believe that STOPPED state should be used.
Fix the formatting of this else statement so it is inline with the correct if statement

@kostyaBoss As the VideoStreamService will be stopped and restarted, we can still dispose of the virtualDisplay in this case as it will be recreated when the VideoStreamService starts again.
Since this is the case we do not need a new shutDown method and can continue to use the old one

@RHenigan Thanks for your reply. I still think we should not dispose thevirturalDisplay because it leads to disposal of the view (overridden by the developer) bonded to virtualDisplay and as a result, leads to loss of the state each time when new capability will come (because the view is reflectively re-instantiated and bounded to the virtualDisplay on the system level).
Indeed, according to the proposal, we should restart the service, but as for me, it doesn't seem like expected behaviour to have the state lost but not kept after all the things have been adjusted.
For e.x if the developer will override the view with the WebView component inside -> the current web page on the new capability would be lost and the user will be forced to renavigate there
Please, let me know the next steps required assuming posted examples and arguments

Hello @kostyaBoss after further discussion with the team it would fall on the developer to save the state of their presentation class that is extending the SdlRemoteDisplay. the library would then still dispose of the virtualDisplay and when the presentation is reinstantiated the developer should have the saved state available.
If the library is to handle the state of the stream there would need to be a change to the proposal
This should be split into two seperate setters, setMaxAspectRatio and setMinAspectRatio
@RHenigan wouldn't it produce the case when the higher or lower boundary can be not configured?
the same would then be true for the Resolution min and max, in the isImageResolutionInRange method we have null checks to handle this, the same should be added to the isAspectRatioInRange method.
We should add a null check for originalAdditionalCapabilities, it is possible for the HMI to send additionalVideoStreamingCapabilities as null and if that is the case there will be a NPE here

@kostyaBoss Now that we have reverted the change to the shutdown method of VirtualDisplayEncoder do we still need this change here?
If not I believe all changes in this file can be reverted

Hello @kostyaBoss I dont this that this should be made public as this should only ever be called with TRUE from within the library and for any cases where the developer would be calling this method with FALSE I believe it would be better to use the existing stopStreaming method.
I propose removing the deprecated annotation from the existing stopStreaming method and making this method private
If the proposed changes are made for the stopStreaming methods, this change can be reverted
This should refer back to stopStreaming() instead of stopStreaming(boolean withPendingRestart)

The proposal was not very clear on what properties should get set on OnAppCapabilityUpdated.appCapability. videoStreamingCapability so we have decided we should not set the root videoStreamingCapability but only the additionalVideoStreamingCapabilities as outlined below:

Mobile checks both the root videoStreamingCapability and the additionalVideoStreamingCapabilities to see which ones it can support.
Mobile sends an OnAppCapabilityUpdated with only the VideoStreamingCapability.additionalVideoStreamingCapabilities parameter set. The  additionalVideoStreamingCapabilities should be set with all the capabilities it can support as determined by step 1.

Hello @kostyaBoss, per this comment:

Mobile checks both the root videoStreamingCapability and the additionalVideoStreamingCapabilities to see which ones it can support.

We should update getSupportedCapabilities(List<VideoStreamingRange>, List<VideoStreamingCapability>) to instead be getSupportedCapabilities(List<VideoStreamingRange>, VideoStreamingCapability)
the VideoStreamingCapability that is passed in will contain a VideoStreamingCapability at the root level as well as the list of additionalVideoStreamingCapabilities. We should be comparing the VideoStreamingCapability at the root level against the ranges as well as the list of additionalVideoStreamingCapabilities.
Currently the implementation is only comparing the list of additionalVideoStreamingCapabilities against the ranges.
@kostyaBoss this will cause an NPE is getAdditionalVideoStreamingCapabilities is null
To maintain code style throughout the library please update this call to a single line rather than split the parameters across different lines.
To maintain code style throughout the library please update this call to a single line rather than split the parameters across different lines.
If range is null this will cause an NPE
To maintain code style throughout the library please update this method signature to a single line rather than split the parameters across different lines.
To maintain code style throughout the library please update this method signature to a single line rather than split the parameters across different lines.

After Aligning changes with the iOS library there are some cases that were not accounted for or not aligned between the two libraries. Mainly these changes are to decide what it means if the developer set a null range or a range where the Resolutions are (0, 0) and how to handle these cases.

If both supportedPortraitStreamingRange and supportedLandscapeStreamingRange are not set or set to null by the developer, then the mobile library will support all VideoStreamingCapabilities returned by the module. This is done to ensure that streaming works as intended for developers who don't update the library to add the supportedPortraitStreamingRange and supportedLandscapeStreamingRange parameters.
To disable either supportedPortraitStreamingRange or supportedLandscapeStreamingRange, the developer has to set a VideoStreamingRange with the minimumResolution and maximumResolution set to 0 width and 0 height. If the developer chooses to disable both supportedPortraitStreamingRange and supportedLandscapeStreamingRange, video will not stream.
If supportedPortraitStreamingRange is not set or was set to null then the library will assume that all VideoStreamingCapabilities with a portrait aspect ratio are supported. The same is true if supportedLandscapeStreamingRange is not set; the library will assume that all VideoStreamingCapabilities with a landscape aspect ratio are supported.

For point 3) please refer to the iOS implementation on how to determine if a capability is a portrait or landscape capability
matchVideoCapability and isCapability in this file
as well as SDLImageResolutionKind in this file

Hello @kostyaBoss per this comment
If the developer uses this methos we should assume that the ranges are null and there for all capabilities would be supported.

This enum will only be fore use inside of the library and because of this we should add a @RestrictTo annotation
@RestrictTo(RestrictTo.Scope.LIBRARY)
If rootCapability is null this null check will be too late as the line above will throw an npe when calling rootCapability.getAdditionalVideoStreamingCapabilities()
In this case we can return validCapabilities right after adding all capabilities
This should not be an else condition, in the event that one of the ranges are null and the other isn't then we still need to check the capabilities against the non-null range.

@RHenigan Hi! I am a little bit confused with this comment because from my understanding the null-safety is covered by the lines 803-817. Please, let me know If I am missing something - I will be ready to introduce the fix ASAP

Helo @kostyaBoss,
lines 803-817 here are checking if only one of the ranges is null, If one range is null then capabilities of that type are added to valid capabilities. But after that we still need to check against the non-null range and compare the capabilities to that range.
i.e.
landScapeRange == null and portraitRange != null
All the landScape Capabilities are added to validCapabilities
Now we need to compare the capabilities received to the portraitRange that the developer has defined
Add any capabilities that match the portraitRange to validCapabilities
And the reverse would also need to happen if landScapeRange != null and portraitRange == null
With that being the case, I think this method can be simplified, looking at the iOS implementation here
getSupportedCapability would iterate over the list of capabilities
Identify the ImageResoultionType
call inRange with the capability and the correct Range
and inRange will return true if the range is null or the range matches, and false if the range does not match or is ZeroRange
@RHenigan thanks for the detailed reply, checking now
@RHenigan could you please confirm the changes are suitable? Pushed the latest version into this PR
These values are getting set twice right after each other, I think it is better to leave the setting of these two values to the configureGlobalParameters method
If the developer continues to use this method we should pass null ranges
A Null range will indicate no restrictions on the capabilities send so it should return true in this case

Hello @kostyaBoss,
I want to make sure that the documentation surrounding this method is clear to the developer. Please see the documentation below, to better align with the iOS library I also recommend change the parameter names from landscapeRange and portraitRange to supportedLandscapeStreamingRange and supportedPortraitStreamingRange
/**
     * Starts streaming a remote display to the module if there is a connected session. This method of streaming requires the device to be on API level 19 or higher
     * Two ranges (supportedLandscapeStreamingRange and supportedLandscapeStreamingRange) can be provided with image dimension ranges and aspect ratio ranges that your remoteDisplay class supports.
     * If the module's screen size for your app changes during streaming (i.e. to a collapsed view, split screen, preview mode, or picture-in-picture), your remoteDisplay will be resized to the new screen size.
     * If either range is `null`, the default is to support all streaming ranges of that format (landscape or portrait).
     * If you wish to disable support for streaming in a given format (landscape or portrait), set a VideoStreamingRange with all `0` values.
     *
     * NOTE If both supportedLandscapeStreamingRange and supportedLandscapeStreamingRange are disabled then the video will not stream.
     *
     * Any changes to screen size will notify the onViewResized method you have implemented in your remoteDisplay class.
     *
     *
     * @param context            a context that can be used to create the remote display
     * @param remoteDisplayClass class object of the remote display. This class will be used to create an instance of the remote display and will be projected to the module
     * @param parameters         streaming parameters to be used when streaming. If null is sent in, the default/optimized options will be used.
     *                           If you are unsure about what parameters to be used it is best to just send null and let the system determine what
     *                           works best for the currently connected module.
     * @param encrypted         a flag of if the stream should be encrypted. Only set if you have a supplied encryption library that the module can understand.
     * @param supportedLandscapeStreamingRange      constraints for vehicle display : min/max aspect ratio, min/max resolutions, max diagonal size.
     * @param supportedLandscapeStreamingRange      constraints for vehicle display : min/max aspect ratio, min/max resolutions, max diagonal size.
     */

Here we should also be checking if the list is empty,
If no ranges are supported the video should not be streamed

This should return false, the developer can set the minResolution or maxResolution in the range to null if they choose to only compare against aspectRatio and/or screen diagonal
A range will be considered disabled if the minResolution and maxResolution are explicitly set to (0 width, 0 height)

This should return false, the developer can set the minResolution or maxResolution in the range to null if they choose to only compare against aspectRatio and/or screen diagonal
A range will be considered disabled if the minResolution and maxResolution are explicitly set to (0 width, 0 height)
Unit tests should be added for this method
Unit tests should be added for this method

@kostyaBoss, Please add more unit tests here,
There should be tests for
testResolutionOutOfRange
testAspectRatioOutOfRange
testResolutionWithNullResolutionRange (Range resolutions are set to null and should return true)
testAspectRatioWithNullAspectRatioRange (Range aspect Ratios are set to null and should return true)
testResolutionWithDisabledResolutionRange (Range resolutions have 0 width and height values and should return false)
testResolutionWithDisabledAspectRatioRange (Range aspectRatios have 0 values and should return false)

Per the proposal, getSupportedCapabilities should be defined as:
"...
private List<VideoStreamingCapability> getSupportedCapabilities( Resolution minResolution, Resolution maxResolution, Double minAspectRatio, Double maxAspectRatio, Double minScreenDiagonal )
..."
Do you need to change your method definition to match with the proposal?
On line 166, you can use the TAG variable instead of "MyTagLog"

You may not need this function public List<VideoStreamingCapability> getAdditionalCapabilities() { return additionalCapabilities; };.
It is not being used.

+    /**
+     * Starts streaming a remote display to the module if there is a connected session. This method of streaming requires the device to be on API level 19 or higher
+     *
+     * @param context            a context that can be used to create the remote display
+     * @param remoteDisplayClass class object of the remote display. This class will be used to create an instance of the remote display and will be projected to the module
+     * @param parameters         streaming parameters to be used when streaming. If null is sent in, the default/optimized options will be used.
+     *                           If you are unsure about what parameters to be used it is best to just send null and let the system determine what
+     *                           works best for the currently connected module.
+     * @param encrypted a flag of if the stream should be encrypted. Only set if you have a supplied encryption library that the module can understand.

+    public void startRemoteDisplayStream(Context context, Class<? extends SdlRemoteDisplay> remoteDisplayClass, VideoStreamingParameters parameters, final boolean encrypted, VideoStreamingRange landscapeRange, VideoStreamingRange portraitRange) {

nodes.bodyText:
@kostyaBoss Per the proposal, isImageResolutionInRange should be defined as public Boolean isImageResolutionInRange(VideoStreamingRange range, ImageResolution currentResolution).
Your definition is different because you take in two Resolution objects instead of just the VideoStreamingRange object. Do you need to change yours to match up with the proposal?
@santanamk in the proposal it was just a section where a preview example was provided. To keep libraries mirroring each other we've agreed to make this method accept two arguments

@kostyaBoss Per the proposal, isAspectRatioInRange should be defined as public Boolean isAspectRatioInRange(VideoStreamingRange range, ImageResolution currentResolution).
Your definition is different because you take in an AspectRatio object instead of a VideoStreamingRange object. Do you need to change yours to match up with the proposal?
@santanamk in the proposal it was just a section where a preview example was provided. To keep libraries mirroring each other we've agreed to make this method accept two arguments
@kostyaBoss On line 194 after the @ it should be since instead of sInCe.
@kostyaBoss On line 205 after the @ it should be since instead of SInCE.

@kostyaBoss I checked out your code generator tool: https://github.com/LuxoftSDL/rpc_spec.git
Lines 3273-3296 define the VideoStreamingCapability struct.  If you place your AppCapability XML below that struct then you should be able to generate it.  Also the XML for AppCapabilityType (enum) should be placed above AppCapability XML when you do this.
